name: Gochujang Beef Jerky
description: A super simple beef jerky recipe anyone can make at home with their oven. No need for a food dehydrator or fancy equipment, just a couple of oven racks and away you go!
keywords: Beef Jerky, Homemade Jerky, Gochujang Beef, Oven Dried Beef, Spicy Beef Jerky, Korean Style Jerky, High Protein Snack, Lean Beef Recipe, Soy Sauce Marinade, Sriracha, Brown Sugar Glaze, No Dehydrator Needed, Easy Jerky Recipe, Dried Meat, Cured Beef, Road Trip Snack, Hiking Food, Savory Snack, Sweet and Spicy Beef, Meat Snack, Chewy Beef, Beer Snack

recipeInstructions.name: Cut Beef
recipeInstructions.text: Cut the beef to your desired width (I prefer 3-5mm) and your desired way (with or against the grain). Personally I prefer mine to be cut against the grain that way its easier to eat.

recipeInstructions.name: Mix
recipeInstructions.text: Mix the beef thoroughly with all of the ingredients and refrigerate for 30 minutes. Mix the beef again and refrigerate for another 30 minutes.

recipeInstructions.name: Prep for Oven
recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 80Â°C. Strain beef and squeeze out excess soy sauce (stops it from being too salty). Lay beef out on racks ensuring it does not overlap.

recipeInstructions.name: Dry
recipeInstructions.text: Dry out in the oven for about 3-5 hours depending on thickness and desired dryness. Personally I like mine thin and dry so I go for about 4-5 hours. I would check it at about 2-3 hours just to see how its going.

recipeInstructions.name: Prep for Oven
recipeInstructions.text: Once you take it out of the oven it will continue to dry so take that into account. Once its cooled down on the bench (don't cover during this) its ready to store in the fridge!

notes: Not very spicy even with the gochujang and Sriracha. If you want more spice you can add a tsp of chili flakes to get that heat.
